Consumer complaint narrative: After accepting a pre-screen offer for credit with an Avant credit card, I checked them out via XXXX and read many complaints and accusations that Avant was processing payments from customers bank accounts without prior authorisation. This was very concerning to me and I made a point NOT to set up automatic payments. All my accts with credit companies are on auto payment except for Avant for this reason. 5 months into my credit history with Avant and I am in good standing with no missed or late payments except for an unusual case where a payment was not processed correctly which lead to me being charged a late fee. I disputed this and contacted Avant via email several times but I was never contacted and my emails went unanswered. Then after making my monthly payment I noticed a second payment was processed in the same month. Then the following month the same thing happened- I made my payment but a second payment was taken out of my account. The next month it happened again! This has happened more than three times. I checked my Avant acct online to confirm automatic payments were not enabled and that there were no scheduled payments. I confirmed this. Today another " unauthorized payment '' was made on my Avant credit account. I called Avant customer service and was met with what I expected - denial of unauthorized payments by the XXXX. I was told that all of the months with double payments were made online via the website. I was told that I must have made the payments and forgot! I absolutely did not make two payments per month. I did not give authorisation for the second payments to be made. I can not understand why Avant would do this but have read multiple instances of the exact same complaint via XXXX search. At this point I am at a loss as to what I should do or even accept as a solution. I am concerned as i have already been the victim of Avants business practices resulting in a late fee that I am sure was dishonest. I do not know to what end Avant has to gain by taking double payments but I am not a credit card company making money off fees.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
This complaint is regarding the financial, emotional, and XXXX  damages that I have acquired due to many errors and incongruencies of the consumer credit report furnished by Equifax on my behalf for various years without my previous written consent. I have addressed Equifax and have pointed out all the violations they have made against me and the laws they are breaking. I have exhausted all means of communication with Equifax, therefore I am now contacting you CFPB, to help put a stop to these abusive practices and help me obtain the remedy I am entitled to. 
- 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 3 ) = Consumer reporting agencies have assumed a vital role in assembling and evaluating consumer credit and other information on consumers. Equifax is not a government agency and I have not given direct permission to Equifax to report on me or for me.

- 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 4 ) = Consumer reporting agencies need to exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. Equifax has not respected my right to privacy. 
- 15 USC 1681a ( d ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ) = Consumer reports do not include information solely as to transactions between the consumer and the person making the report. The report from Equifax displays transactions of alleged debts.

- 15 USC 1681a ( d ) ( 2 ) ( B ) = a consumer report does not include any authorization or approval of a specific extension of credit directly or indirectly by the issuer of a credit card. I am in fact the only one who can issue credit through a credit card, which in this case is issued through my Social Security card, therefore Equifax must stop violating my rights and privacy.

- 15 USC 1681a ( e ) = A consumer report is obtained through personal interviews with friends or neighbors of the consumer and such report shall not include specific factual information on a consumers credit record obtained directly from a creditor of the consumer or from a consumer reporting agency when such information was obtained directly from a creditor of the consumer. All accounts that Equifax has or had included in my consumer report have been obtained from third parties not authorized or permitted by law. 
- 15 USC 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ) = A consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. I have only given directions to Equifax in my recent correspondences, to furnish such report including only information that follows my written instructions, but Equifax has continued to report incorrect data.

- Pursuant to the FCRA and Public Law No. 91-508 ( 15 USC 1681g ), Equifax has not disclosed to me any documents that they have recorded and retained in their file at the time of the requests concerning the accounts that Equifax has or had reported in my credit report, therefore, all accounts must be deleted immediately.

Equifax has willfully failed to comply with any requirement imposed under Title 15 Chapter 41 Subchapter III and FCRA, therefore I am entitled to {$1000.00} per violation, not including actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the damages. 
Notice 1 was received by Equifax on XX/XX/2021 by XXXX  Priority Express number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX US. 
Notice 2 was received by Equifax on XX/XX/2021 by XXXX  Certified number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
Notice 3 was received by Equifax on XX/XX/2021 by XXXX  Certified number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
Notice 3 was also received as Cc by the XXXX  of this agency on XX/XX/2021 by XXXX  Certified number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
Attached are all the documents, exhibits displaying statutory damages, Bill of Particulars/Invoices, and overall proof of my claims that further supports my case. Please help to enforce my rights and to ensure Equifax follows the law as well as my demands/instructions included in my letters.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you have contacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming this. 
Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor. 
In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : XXXX. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor. 
XXXX. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed. 
XXXX. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor. 
XXXX. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt. 
XXXX. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor. 
Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt. 
Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt. 
Permissible Purpose Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so. 
Notification to Other Collectors I dispute that I owe this debt to you. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute the accuracy of the information on my credit reports provided by TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX. After reviewing the reports, I have identified inconsistencies that I believe warrant your attention and resolution. I kindly request that you investigate and rectify the inaccuracies in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Account Details : XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX Account Type : Installment Account Type - Detail : Auto Loan ( reported as Unsecured loan by XXXX ) Bureau Code : Individual Account Status : Closed Monthly Payment : {$0.00} Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX ( reported as XX/XX/XXXX by TransUnion ) Balance : {$0.00} No. of Months ( terms ) : XXXX ( reported as XXXX by XXXX ) High Credit : {$30000.00} XXXX XXXX : {$0.00} Past Due : {$0.00} Payment Status : Current ( reported as Late 30 Days by XXXX ) Last Reported : XX/XX/XXXX ( reported as XX/XX/XXXX by XXXX ) Inaccuracies and Potential FCRA Violations : FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) - Reporting Accurate Account Information : The " Date Opened '' is reported differently by TransUnion and XXXX, with a discrepancy of approximately one month. This inconsistency may be a violation of FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), which requires credit reporting agencies to provide accurate and complete information about consumer accounts. 

FCRA Section 605 ( a ) ( 4 ) - Reporting Accurate Account Status : XXXX reports the account as " Late 30 Days, '' while TransUnion and XXXX indicate " Current '' and " Paid, '' respectively. This inconsistency may violate FCRA Section 605 ( a ) ( 4 ), which requires accurate reporting of the account 's payment status. 

FCRA Section 605 ( a ) ( 6 ) - Reporting Accurate Credit Limit : XXXX erroneously reports the " Account Type - Detail '' as " Unsecured loan, '' which affects the " Credit Limit '' field, showing " {$0.00}. '' This is inaccurate as the account is an " Auto Loan '' and does not have a credit limit. This may be a violation of FCRA Section 605 ( a ) ( 6 ), which mandates accurate reporting of credit limit information. 

I request that you conduct a thorough investigation into these discrepancies and promptly take corrective action to remove the inaccuracies from my credit reports. As per the FCRA, please provide me with written confirmation of the corrections made. 

I am attaching copies of relevant supporting documents that validate my claims. I trust that TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX will fulfill their obligations under the FCRA to ensure accurate and fair reporting of consumer credit information. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I anticipate a swift resolution and the removal of the inaccuracies from my credit reports. 

Sincerely,

At that time, I requested that Macys change my due date. Nothing was done, they continued to charge me late charge every month. This is illegal and unethical. I had a XXXX   account in the past, I had the same kind of billing problems which forced me to close my account. The payment should have been corrected in XX/XX/2018. That was the date that I called to move the payment date behind the XXXX  of the month which is when I get paid. XXXX XXXX  never moved the date, but continued to charge me late payments. I asked him why would I be making {$59.00} payment, when the payment was only {$27.00}. He stated that that payment would catch me up. That was he initially told me about the {$48.00} payment. XXXX XXXX is running some type of scam. They are tricking people into believing that if they make a payment, that they will be current, only to find out once they get your payment, you account is not in good standing. Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2021, I received {$50.00} via PayPal from one XXXX XXXX. XXXX  notified me that " money was waiting '' via email so I knew the transfer was complete. I did nothing with the money until, on XX/XX/2021, I made an XXXX purchase in the amount of {$22.00}. I paid with PayPal, expecting that the {$50.00} that was on deposit would be decremented by the amount of the purchase. I checked my PayPal summary page only to discover that such was not the case. The {$50.00} was still there and still " waiting ''. I called PayPal about this and the agent told me that I couldn't access the money unless I supplied a bank account number. I told her that wasn't OK and that I wanted the money either applied to future purchases, applied as a credit to one of the two credit cards I had on file, or sent to me in the form of a check. She said no and advised that she would refund the money to the sender, XXXX XXXX, and that XXXX could send me the money some other way. Following this call, I contacted XXXX and explained the situation and asked that, if she were to get the promised refund, could she please just send me a check. A week or so went by and I heard nothing, so I checked my PayPal summary page again to see if the refund took place. It had not- {$50.00} still " waiting ''. 

I called PayPal again, reiterating my prior complaint and voicing my displeasure with the preceding experience, and the agent who helped me assured me that the situation was resolved and that my next purchase would " tap '' the {$50.00}. So, on XX/XX/2021, I made another XXXX purchase in the amount of {$22.00}, expecting to see the {$50.00} decremented. Again, this did not happen. 

So, again, I called PayPal and yet another agent told me that, in order to have access to my money, I needed to set up the " cash account '' or " link a bank account ''. There was, he said, no way to send a check ( even though the website had a " send a paper check instead '' button ) or put the money against my existing credit cards. I told him that I did not want to give out my bank account number and/or my complete identity ( full legal name, address, social security number, last four of the social security number, and date of birth ) just to access money someone else had sent me. I indicated that my money was basically a XXXX to PayPal 's XXXX  for personal information and that I didn't like that and would communicate this to the regulatory authorities ( that being you ). 

Just around the first of XXXX, XXXX, I was contemplating writing to you about this issue, but I decided to give PayPal another call because each time I had called previously, there was a new twist from the agent on the phone. So I called again, and this fourth time, the agent seemed much more sympathetic to my complaint, indicating that he had heard this many times before. After considerable back and forth, he said that the option to choose how to pay was displayed when I entered the " Pay with PayPal '' screen at the time of purchase- that this would be visible as " Source of Funds ''. He implored my to try that on the next purchase and said that, if access to the {$50.00} was not successful after that, I should call again and they would " cut me a check ''. So yesterday, I went on XXXX and attempted to purchase some literature for {$18.00} plus shipping. When I went to pay with PayPal, I attempted to located the " Source of Funds '' choice to which this agent had eluded. It wasn't there. I cancelled the purchase and called PayPal again today with this whole story, asking this time to speak with a supervisor. I was told that the {$50.00} I had available could only be had if I provided the personal information they wanted, otherwise they would just keep it. 

After this, I went back on XXXX and bought my literature and paid directly with my credit card, thus bypassing PayPal altogether. Following the purchase, I attempted to locate a number for the PayPal Corporate offices to voice my complaint higher up the food chain, but the number supplied online eventually took me back to the same " customer service '' place I had been to so many times before, where the agent again said the the {$50.00} would be held pending the disclosure of the information they wanted. I again repeated that I wanted the money applied to future purchases, put back on the credit card ( s ) I had already on file, or sent via check. She refused. 

It was at this point that I contacted your office to request assistance and was told to submit this complaint. Your representative mentioned that there were " thousands '' of complaints against PayPal but that she didn't know if any were exactly my issue. 

What I want is my {$50.00}. They can apply it to future purchases ( the preferred method ), credit it to the credit card I have on file, or send me a check for the money. 

What I want for everybody is for this practice to be disclosed up front. Had I known that the money that I was offered via PayPal would be held XXXX for personal information, I would not have agreed to accept payment via PayPal. I suspect that had the sender known this, she might have offered to pay a different way. PayPal needs to get agreement from all parties BEFORE the money changes hands. I think that if all parties are aware of this crazy policy, fewer will be likely to offer payment via or accept payment from PayPal. 

One final note : I am willing to supply to you any necessary information, including my login information so that you can see the trail for yourself. Please simply let me know if I can assist in any way. Please note that PayPal states that all calls are recorded and that " notes '' are kept by their representatives when customer service calls are received, so PayPal will be the repository of all related documentation and conversation regarding this matter. 

Regards, XXXX XXXX

Product: Bank account or service
Consumer complaint narrative: I use BBVA Compass for my banking as a long-time customer ( approx. 15 years ), even though I recently moved out of their region. My direct deposit was supposed to hit my account today ( XXXX/XXXX/16 ), but the bank is saying that because it is a holiday, they wo n't process it until Monday, the next business day. For an automated electronic transaction, this makes XXXX sense to me. Are their ATM 's turned off today too? I also tried to set up an electronic transfer online to send some money tomorrow ( in the hopes that it processes by then ) to my ex-wife so that my kids are taken care of, and received a message that the transaction could n't be processed because of the holiday. When I called customer service to complain and ask for an explanation, I was told repeatedly ( XXXX calls throughout the day ) that they have had a software update, and their customer service personnel have no access to accounts. On my last call, I was placed on hold for 25 minutes, and when the " supervisor '' picked up, he promptly hung up as soon as I said hello. Although I expressed my frustration and the fact that I deem this level of service unacceptable, at no time was I rude or engaged in personal vitriol. If a financial institution is going to forbid access to its customers accounts, or refuse to process something as simple as a direct deposit, I believe that it should be required to notify its customers to that effect. The fact that many people are on payroll schedules that might fall on a holiday is a common occurrence, and one that I have seen dealt with before ( I work in XXXX ).

I had already contacted the merchant who was in full cooperation and ready to comply with the chargeback. I was transferred to a supervisor in the dispute claims department named " XXXX '' he declined to tell me his last name. This supervisor XXXX flat out refused to open a new claim for me, he instead told me that I had to wait for my initial claim to be " reconsidered ''. I submitted all evidentiary paperwork in advance, the claim was a cut and dry easy resolution but XXXX flat out refused to process it for me in a timely manner despite my explanation of my temporary hardship situation. He basically told me that he would get around to it whenever he felt like it. I was apalled by his rude and blatant disregard towards me. This supervisor XXXX has literally deliberately refused to process my claim for no other reason but because he can. The merchant is waiting to hear from BofA so this matter can be resolved, its been two weeks now and we are still waiting unecessarily because of a rude and childish supervisor who flat out refuses to do his job for certain customers whom he deems to be " less worthy ''. This supervisor XXXX 's attitude towards me was callous, highly unprofessional and outright disrespectful. Every other employee with BofA that Ive spoken to has been wonderful, polite and helpful. XXXX insisted that they were all misinformed that he alone was the final word. Im shocked that BofA would tolerate that kind of tyrannical behavior from their supervisors, not only towards their fellow employees, but towards clients as well.

On XX/XX/2023 I filed a dispute with Bank of America in the amount of {$400.00} for a charge that I made with my Bank of America debit card ( ending in XXXX ) to a merchant ( XXXX XXXX ) for goods and services that have not been delivered or performed. I have followed the guidelines provided by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, Federal Trade Commission and the State of Georgia Attorney General 's office of Consumer Affairs in their guidelines to attempt to recoup the {$400.00} paid to the merchant which includes : 1. a failed attempted negotiation with the merchant for recoup of funds or delivery of the goods ; 2. disputing the {$400.00} transaction with my bank , Bank of America . However, as of the date of this complaint I have ye
t to receive a satisfactory result which would be Bank of America supporting my dispute and restoring the {$400.00} funds to my account. I am disappointed and dismayed at the lack of action on the part of Bank of America in support of me as their consumer, especially in light of the deceptive consumer practices recently attributed to Bank of America. I would think that BoA would want to restore the trust of consumers rather than further eroding that trust. I am respectfully requesting that the {$400.00} be restored to me, forthwith. I have provided and proven to Bank of America that the merchant failed to satisfy the terms for this transaction. In addition, BoA has placed the burden of proof on me as their customer, when instead it should have been the merchant providing proof of the satisfaction and delivery of these goods and services that I paid for, which the merchant can not, and will not, be able to show. If the {$400.00} is not restored to my Bank of America account, I will be withdrawing the remainder of my funds and taking my banking business elsewhere.

Consumer complaint narrative: I had last used my prepaid XXXX card on XX/XX/XXXX and it had a balance of {$640.00}. When I went to use it on XX/XX/XXXX it had under {$10.00} on it. On XX/XX/XXXX I called and reported that fraud had occurred. I was sent dispute paperwork in the mail which I filled out and returned via email. I called and made sure they received my completed dispute forms and was told they did and I would be informed of their decision via letter. I got a letter saying my claims were denied due to " inconsistent conflicting information ''. The letter also states " You have the right to request copies of the documents that we relied on in making our determination ''. I called to request this information and was told I could file an appeal and ask for the documents. I did both via email and a written letter. I called to make sure they had received my appeal and was told they had and I would hear from them in 45-90 days. That time had passed and I heard nothing. I called and was told my appeal was denied and I would get a letter explaining their decision and documentation in 7-10 business days. That was on XX/XX/XXXX and I didn't get anything. I called this morning ( XX/XX/XXXX ) and was told I didn't get anything because there was no documentation to send me. It was my understanding that they are required to show documentation that they did in fact carry out an investigation of my claims and that the disputed transactions were indeed authorized ( which they were not ). During this process I got a letter stating that I needed to get in touch with the fraud department because they needed more information and when I called the number on the letter I would only get the general customer service department who couldn't tell me what more information I need to provide and just told me to further explain my claim which I did via email. I found out today that there is no way to directly speak to the fraud department only to general customer service who can't talk to me about my case only read vague notes on the computer left by the fraud department.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am attempting to apply for a mortgage and it was identified that I had a mark on my credit report for {$120.00} from MediCredit , Inc . It shows the case was opened on XX/XX/XXXX, reported on XX/XX/XXXX, but also a XXXX balance. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I called MediCredit, Inc at XXXX and explained I wanted to find out what the issue was. They stated they needed an account number, my phone number, and/or my name. I did not have an account number so I provided my name and phone number -- neither showed that I had an account. The rep told me they could not help me since I did not show I ever had an account. I explained MediCredit put a mark on my credit report so I needed to speak to someone about removing it. The representative told me MediCredit did not remove marks on credit reports -- and that I could not be forwarded on to a supervisor or anyone else since I am not showing I ever had an account. I explained multiple times that I needed some way to speak to someone who could help since it sounded like it was an incorrect mark on my credit report. The representative would not provide me a name or help me any further.

I called back four other times, hoping to get through to a representative who could help me. Please note that on my second or third call, the representative asked me for my SSN. The first rep had mentioned to me that no one should ever ask for my SSN to verify my account so I did not provide that to her. Only one out of five representatives asked for my SSN -- I believe her name was XXXX. I know I spoke to a XXXX  at one point. 

On the fourth call, the representative, " XXXX, '' said she found my account. She was able to do that by asking me additional details about myself that no other rep did. It turns out, my information was not correct in their system. She would not tell me everything that was incorrect but one item was definitely my name. She asked me a bunch of information about my current address, number, name -- and updated the system. She also provided me with an Account Number.

After she found my account, I explained my situation and asked to talk to someone about having the mark on my credit removed. She explained that MediCredit never removes marks. I explained that I have called multiple times and no one has been able to find my account. And if no one could find my account then whatever had been sent to me either never made it, did not have my name or information correct, and/or looked like spam. 

She told me the only thing that she could do for me was to provide me a letter showing that my account had a XXXX balance. She told me she also saw on XX/XX/XXXX ( unsure year ), my account showed that it was, " recalled. '' She believe that meant the delinquency should have been removed. I asked for a letter explaining on XX/XX/XXXX that the delinquency was removed -- and asked if she could include that in my XXXX balance letter. She told me she could not do that. That she could only send me a XXXX balance letter. I asked to talk to her supervisor and she told me they would tell me the same thing she is. She advised me to try and contact the credit agencies to have the delinquency removed and recommended using the " XXXX XXXX '' app and repeated that they could not help. 

After pleading with her to talk to her supervisor, she continued to explain that none of her three supervisors were available and that they would be telling me the same thing she is. After about 10 minutes of me saying I would wait until one was available she transferred me to a, " Mr. XXXX XXXX. '' The phone rang to voicemail so I left a message explaining my issue and have not heard back. 

My request is to have the negative mark/delinquency on my credit report removed from all three credit agencies. After my multiple attempts to work with MediCredit yesterday it is clear to me that they did not have my correct information and the error is on their side. They did not have my first and last name or phone number anywhere in their system. I am very good at paying my debts and would not purposefully avoid paying one -- especially one at {$120.00}. This one {$120.00} mark on my credit is hurting my score by ~80 points and affecting my loan so I am asking that this be resolved as soon as possible. My " fear '' now is if they have to provide you with their records that they will only show my correct information that was updated yesterday -- and not show how their system actually had me during their debt collection period. 

An additional request is to look into MediCredit 's processes and practices. The fact that I could not get to a supervisor without an account was very frustrating. And the fact that the supervisor still has not reached back out to me is beyond annoying. There may be other individuals who have been mistreated by this company as well.

Thank you for your time.

I believe this incorrect reporting is a violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which requires credit bureaus to maintain accurate and fair reporting. I am requesting the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau 's assistance in ensuring that the credit bureaus conduct a thorough investigation and promptly correct these inaccuracies. These errors are affecting my credit profile and could impact my ability to secure credit, housing, and employment.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/2024 Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, Iowa XXXX Subject : Complaint Against NATLCRSYS for Violating My Rights Under 15 USC 1681-s 2 ( 7 ) ( A ) Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to file a formal complaint against NATLCRSYS for violating my rights under 15 USC 1681-s 2 ( 7 ) ( A ) by reporting inaccurate information on my consumer report. As a consumer, I am deeply concerned about the impact of this inaccurate reporting on my financial well-being and reputation. 

On XX/XX/2024, I obtained a copy of my consumer report from the CRA and discovered that there were several inaccuracies in the information reported. Specifically, the date this account was opened, and date last active, all three bureaus are showing different dates. 

These inaccuracies have had a detrimental effect on my credit score and have made it difficult for me to access credit or financial services.

This has caused me undue stress and financial hardship, as I have been unfairly penalized for information that is not a true reflection of my credit history.

I believe that NATLCRSYS 's actions are in direct violation of my rights under 15 USC 1681-s 2 ( 7 ) ( A ), which requires consumer reporting agencies to maintain accurate and up-to-date information on consumer reports. By failing to do so, NATLCRSYS has not only harmed my financial standing but has also undermined my trust in the consumer reporting system.

Additionally, under 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) ( 4 ) ( i ), debt collectors are required to provide consumers with written notification of their rights. I have not received any such notification from NATLCRSYS, which is a clear violation of this regulation.

I am seeking your assistance in investigating this matter and ensuring that NATLCRSYS complies with the relevant laws and regulations governing consumer reporting.

I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to a prompt resolution. 

Thank you for your time and assistance. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Failure to Provide Background Report I am writing to formally complain about the difficulties I have encountered in obtaining a copy of my background report from HireRight. Over the past four months, I have made multiple attempts to receive this report, but my efforts have been consistently thwarted. 
On two separate occasions, HireRight provided me with a link and a password to access my background report. However, the passwords provided were invalid, rendering me unable to access my report. Despite following up on this issue, the problem remains unresolved. 
According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am entitled to receive a copy of my background report. HireRights failure to provide me with this information in a timely and accurate manner is not only frustrating but also a violation of my rights under the FCRA. 
I request that HireRight : 1. Provide me with a correct and accessible link and password to my background report immediately.

2. Conduct a thorough investigation into why my initial requests were not fulfilled.

3. Take the necessary steps to ensure that such issues do not recur in the future. 
Please treat this matter with the urgency it deserves. I expect a response and resolution to my complaint within 14 days of receipt of this letter. If this issue is not resolved promptly, I will consider taking further action, including but not limited to filing a complaint United State District COURT and seeking legal advice.

Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
For months this company has been reporting inaccurate, unverifiable erroneous things on my credit report and ruining my credit score and I am sick of it. This company has ruined my credit score so bad I got denied a loan for my house!! Now I can not provide for my family because of these derogatory marks. These medical bills and other derogatory collection accounts listed on my credit report, are incorrect and NOT mine. Simply verifying that someone used my name, social security number and/or address is insufficient to confirm that I am the person in question and owe this debt. 
The court has ruled that in Hinkle v. Midland Credit Management , Inc.,  that during a dispute and subsequent investigation with the original creditor, collector or a credit bureau, that the original creditor or collector, must provide account-level documentation that would hold up when presented to a jury. That means an original contract or similar proof. To this end, I am demanding an itemized bill to include but not limited to : The diagnosis and procedure performed that I am being billed for, Dates of said procedure, Cost of any medication you may have provided, Cost of any medical devices you may have provided, Office Visits, Consultations, Hospital Visits, Misc. 
As I am not the person who owes this bill, I am aware that providing the information requested may lead to third party disclosure : a HIPAA violation. That would be your problem and not mines, as a consumer. And per the FCRA and FCPA, I am not required to complete a police report since the burden to prove the debt is on you. 
In addition, a provision of the FACTA regulations is the Notice of Negative Information provision, covered in section 623 ( A ) ( 7 ). 
I have never received notification that this had been or was going to be listed with a credit reporting agency. FACTA ( Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act ) requires creditors, including doctors and hospitals, to give the consumer a warning notice, so the matter can be addressed before a negative item such as this is reported in error. 
I am also requesting a copy of your in-house procedures that enable you to avoid the problems that lead to improper identification of consumers and the subsequent misreporting to the credit bureaus. 
In lieu of supplying the information Im demanding, you can simply stop all collection activity, including but not limited to removing this item from all credit bureaus to which it has been reported. If this is not done within 30 days of receipt of this letter, I will proceed to exercise all my legal rights, including litigation, to protect my good name. 

A response with a bill is NOT evidence of proof that the debt is mine. Anyone can open an account under my name for which a bill is produced, but that doesn't mean it was actually me or that the debt is actually mine. I need real evidence. This evidence consists of a contract from the original creditor or some agreement bearing MY written signature agreeing to pay the debt. In the absence of this evidence I ask you to please remove this account from my credit report. 

A DELETION OF THIS ACCOUNT FROM MY CREDIT REPORT IS A FAIR RESOLUTION.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to request that you conduct a review of Citis consumer dispute policies and procedures. I do not feel that a complete investigation was conducted regarding my billing dispute XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I initiated a billing dispute online via Citis website regarding the transaction posted XX/XX/XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter requesting that I provide specific details and documentation regarding the billing dispute. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I provided Citi a detailed statement and documents via e-mail regarding the reasons I am disputing the amount. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received an e-mail from Citi stating they contacted the merchant and gave the merchant until XX/XX/XXXX, to respond. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received notice from Citi with the response they had received from the merchant. The letter requested a signed letter detailing my response to the merchants claims. Additionally, Citi requested dates I had contacted the merchant and their response to my request for a refund. Citi requested a response by XX/XX/XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I provided a response to Citi via e-mail that stated my response was in addition to the previous response I submitted dated XX/XX/XXXX. My initial letter detailed the attempts to obtain a refund from the merchant, who stated on XX/XX/XXXX, As things return to normal and our cash flow returns to normal we will issue a refund. To date, we have not received a refund from the merchant. Additionally, my follow-up letter informed Citi that I had never received nor signed the document the merchant provided, and again advised that the merchant did not supply any goods or services. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a letter from Citi dated XX/XX/XXXX, informing me that Citi had reversed the conditional credit and they were unable to assist. Since this letter did not provide a written explanation as to the reasons why Citi found in favor of the merchant I contacted Citi via phone and was advised that my follow-up response submitted on XX/XX/XXXX, needed to include information that was provided in my initial letter dated XX/XX/XXXX. I was informed that a good faith credit would be requested. My wife also contacted Citi and was informed that our response was not submitted timely and we were past Visas charge back date of XX/XX/XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, my wife contacted Citi and was informed that the dispute had been reopened and to disregard the closed notification letter dated XX/XX/XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received another letter from Citi dated XX/XX/XXXX, stating the XXXX is unable to assist with the dispute as they have no recourse available to recover the funds. Again, since the letter did not provide a written explanation as to the reasons why Citi is unable to recover the funds I contacted the Company via phone and was informed that Visa reviews disputes and made the determination.

Pursuant to 12 CFR 1026.13 ( b ) ( 2 ) Citi did not properly complete an investigation within two complete billing cycles, nor did they provide the reasons they found in favor of the merchant. I did NOT receive any goods or services from merchant. Additionally, the merchants response to Citi did not include compelling evidence of a signed contract, nor did it include documentation that I had been provided a copy of the documentation that they sent to Citi. 

It appears Citi did not properly review my responses that were submitted in a timely manner. Additionally, it appears that since Citi did not properly complete its investigation within 90 days, Visa is advising it is past the charge back date.

Additionally, when a consumer advises Citi that the contract the merchant provided to Citi was never seen, nor signed by the consumer, and goods or services were NOT provided, it should be expected that Citis policies and procedures would include reaching back out to the merchant to obtain proof of a signed contract, or proof that the contract the merchant provided was provided to the consumer at the time of the transaction. However, that was never done by Citi. 

Additionally, I am not sure what policies and procedures Citi has when submitting the dispute to Visa to review but since I did NOT receive any good or services from the merchant, it is my understanding that this should have been disputed under Visa Condition XXXX Cancelled Merchandise/Services rather than Visa Condition XXXX Not as Described or Defective Merchandise/Services. I believe it was processed under the XXXX Condition based on the letter from Citi dated XX/XX/XXXX which provided the Dispute Reason Code as 1330. Again, I feel this was the improper condition as NO goods or services were ever received and I requested a full refund prior to the scheduled date services were to be provided. 

In summary, had Citi followed proper policies and procedures and conducted a complete and thorough investigation into this matter Citi would have found this billing dispute as valid and provided a refund to me as the consumer. A complete and through investigation into this matter should have included reaching out to the merchant and obtaining a response prior to 90 days after the dispute was initiated, a complete review of all responses submitted from the customer, and advising the merchant that in order to conduct a proper investigation into this matter Citi requires documentation of a signed contract and proof that their non-refundable deposit policy was properly disclosed to the consumer prior to the deposit transaction.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  I purchased a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX, Illinois and was approved for a loan through Bridgecrest financial institution of about XXXX and I made a down payment of {$2000.00}. I submitted to them my work check stubs, insurance and all other documents they asked for and was approved on the spot for the vehicle. 

On XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  I received an email from Bridgecrest stating that they needed additional documents for the post sales verification process to continue to honor the loan and these documents requested were my Bank Statements for the month of XXXX and my check stubs from XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  I received a phone call from XXXX ( the person who sold me the vehicle at XXXX XXXX  ) stating they needed the Bank Statements by XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  to confirm my direct deposits matched my check stubs because there was a discrepancy with my check stubs and if they were not received by this date then the bank would request that I return the vehicle back to the dealership. He later sent me a link via text message to submit the bank statements through XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX 

On XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  I attempted to upload the documents to XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX  but XXXX sent me a link to submit the XXXX statements instead of the XXXX statements so the system would not allow me to upload them into the system. I called XXXX to inform him of this mishap and per his request, I emailed the XXXX XXXX  Bank Statements to his work email address ( XXXX ) with my direct deposits that matched my check stubs on XX/XX/XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  I received a text message from XXXX stating that he had not received my bank statements and he asked if I could send them to him again so that he could get them uploaded into the system for Bridgecrest. I then sent another email to XXXX with the requested documents and I sent him a text message to confirm that he had received them this time via email. He confirmed that he had received and submitted the bank statements to Bridgecrest and that he would let me know when he received an update. 

On Monday XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  I reached out to XXXX before going to work letting him know that he could leave me a voice message or a text message when he received an update from the bank and that I would give him a call back when I get off work. He texted me back that he hadn't heard anything back rom the bank and that he would let me know as soon as he did and that was the last time I heard from him. 

A week later on XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  I visited XXXX XXXX  to receive to tire air pressure caps for my two back wheels because I hadn't noticed that they were not there upon purchase of the vehicle. No one in the dealership told me that I needed to return the car or that the bank denied my documents. I never received any type of notification XXXX XXXX XXXX or Bridgecrest stating that my documents were not approved for post-verification so I continued to pay on my car note in advance. 

I made payments on my car note on XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  ( {$97.00} ), XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  ( {$65.00} ) and XX/XX/XXXX ( {$130.00} ) ( the due date ). Upon making these payments I still never received notice from the bank XXXX XXXX XXXX that my documents were not approved and that they needed me to return the vehicle so I thought that everything was in the clear. 

On XX/XX/XXXXXXXX  at XXXX XXXX  I called the local police department because my car was not outside and I thought it had been stolen. They informed me that my car was reposed the previous night around XXXX XXXX. 

I immediately called XXXX XXXX to ask them what was the reason for the repossession and they could not give me an answer and suggested I call Bridgecrest since they were the lenders. I called Bridgecrest to inquire about the repossession and the only thing they could tell me was that I did not meet the post verification process due to the discrepancy in my pay ( the initial reason they requested my bank statements ) and when I asked them about receiving my bank statements they told me I had to reach back out to XXXX XXXX. Additionally, the agent told me that it would take about 4-6 weeks for them to reverse the charges and issue me a refund because XXXX XXXX has to inspect the vehicle and confirm that it is in the same condition in which I received it. 

I called XXXX XXXX once again and asked them if my bank statements were submitted and the manager told me they were submitted and the only thing he can see in the system was that the documents were waiting to be reviewed but it did not say whether they were approved or denied. He also repeated to me that they did the post verification process and had a discrepancy in my pay which is why they needed the bank statements in the first place but that the submission of the bank statements typically clears up that discrepancy with the bank. 

I then asked the manager if he could reach out to Bridgecrest in order to find out if they approved or denied my documents on their end since they XXXX XXXX XXXX ) did not have a definite answer and he told me that it was unlikely that he would receive an answer from the bank, especially as a third party. The manager told me he would reach back out to me with any updates whether he received an answer or not from Bridgecrest. 

This phone call prompted me to call Bridgecrest once more to confirm if my bank statements had been approved and looked at by them and they did not have a clear answer for me. They told me that XXXX XXXX handles the contracts and they would have any answers regarding whether or not my documents were looked at and I told them XXXX XXXX did not have any answers for me and told me to call them ( the bank ). During both calls to Bridgecrest I asked to speak to a manager that may be able to give me more answers but they were only able to redirect me to customer relations and said they would not be able to answer the questions I had and only XXXX XXXX could do that. 

Both of these companies have not been able to give me a clear cut explanation as to why my car has been repossessed and they are giving me the run arounds between both of them when I try to get answers. This entire ordeal has been very stressful and tiresome and I would like to request a FULL refund of my {$2000.00} and the {$290.00} I paid towards my car note if Bridgecrest is not going to honor the original loan agreement and they knew full and well that they ( XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) had plans to repossess my car. 

I would also like a full explanation in WRITING as to why my car was repossessed and why I did not receive a phone call, voicemail or email stating to return the vehicle before it was repossessed with my personal belongings. Additionally, I would like to be reimbursed for the cost of going to collect my belongings from XXXX XXXX XXXX the repossession company ) because I was not given the choice to return the vehicle to the dealership on my own accord, which I would have done with no problem had I received notice of the loan being reversed.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Re : Claim Number XXXX I am writing regarding a fraud/scam about two transactions worth of {$500.00} and {$300.00} through XXXX which occurred on XXXX. The narrative below explains the series of events and why I feel the harm could have been prevented or resolved in time. 

I posted an add on XXXX XXXX and I started getting electronic texts from the buyer through XXXX XXXX app about the item I was trying to sell. The buyer showed interest in buying the item and asked me for my address, XXXX number and email id. She claimed she made a payment of {$340.00} through XXXX. I also got an email from XXXX stating the same. I was informed to contact the buyer to make another {$500.00} payment to me so that XXXX can release the original payment. She agreed to send me {$500.00} and asked me to refund that {$500.00} back to her. I resisted and asked I could not understand why I was getting asked to refund the money. I also informed her I can not share the screenshots from my chase bank mobile app. I immediately contacted XXXX XXXX customer support ( at XXXX PM, before the transaction occurred ) for inquiring about the legitimacy of this request ( proof attached here ). 
Shortly after, I got another email stating the total amount of {$890.00} ( XXXX original payment+XXXXXXXX business account bonus+XXXX security fee ) and followed by another email stating {$1100.00} would be released in 30 minutes once I refund the {$500.00} back and pay for the certificate fee of {$300.00}. I replied to the email asking what {$300.00} was for and If I would get the refund. The buyer tried calling me multiple times ( chat history attached here ) and a few minutes later, I received a notification from the chase bank mobile app ( at XXXX PM ) stating the {$300.00} was transferred to a person named XXXX ( screenshot attached here ). I immediately checked my chase bank mobile app and there was another fund transfer of {$500.00} already under pending status. Although, I opened the chase bank mobile app multiple times during that day and I also opened XXXX Pay option on that app but I do not recollect any memory of myself completing the transaction. I called chase bank customer support immediately ( call log history attached here ) and asked to cancel the pending transactions. I was informed that the transaction could not be cancelled even when called within minutes. However, I was reassured that the claims department would be able to take care of it. I also filed a claim for these two transactions. I blocked my chase bank online access immediately after the incident. I then kept getting emails and calls from the fraudulent person multiple times later in the day but I did not entertain. I also filed a police report for harassment through electronic communication ( report attached here ). 

How the harm could have been prevented/resolved? 

I called chase bank customer support immediately within minutes of these transactions and I was informed they could not reverse it but I was reassured that the claims department would be able to take care of it. When I contacted customer claims department of Chase bank, I was asked if I initiated the transaction. I informed that I opened the XXXX through Chase bank mobile app to see who the recipient was, I entered the details but I do not recollect how the transaction was complete. The claims department did not note my claim completely and the call was disconnected unfortunately. However, the claim was submitted incomplete. I called them again and the claim was completed for a fraud/almost scammed. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a denial letter stating the claim was denied as per agreement. I called the claims department and explained there was no agreement that the letter was referring to. I was reassured that the investigation team was taking it as a Fraud and I would be getting my funds back within 10 business days ( by XX/XX/XXXX ). However, I receive another denial letter on XX/XX/XXXX from Chase bank stating the transaction was authorized by me. I appealed the decision and uploaded all the supporting documents to support my case. The documents were accepted on XX/XX/XXXX but the case was denied again. I spoke with the claims department on XX/XX/XXXX and I expressed my legal right to claim refunds of the payments not approved by me under electronic funds transfer act ( XXXX XXXX ). I also referred to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau directive, stating the law applies " if a third party fraudulently induces a consumer into sharing account access information. '' This is when someone tricks you into making a payment. So the whole idea that treachery is involved should mean consumers are protected by XXXX XXXX I was informed by claims department that since the investigation team could not prove those as unauthorized transactions, XXXX XXXX could not be applied since it was a scam. However, shortly after when I spoke with the claims escalation team, I was informed that the bank tried to contact the partner bank on XX/XX/XXXX to recover the funds based on XXXX  XXXX considering a scam, but the funds were withdrawn by the receiver and the partner bank denied the recovery of those funds. 

I also contacted the buyer again to send me the money in a good faith, however, the buyer confirmed she did not receive the money and claimed her money was stuck in the bank as well. In addition, I contacted XXXX and reported this fraudulent account, however I was informed that the Chase bank is one of the partner banks and should be the XXXX responsible for one-time courtesy credit in case they are unable to recover the funds ( in contrary to what I was told by Chase bank to contact the XXXX to give one-time courtesy refunds when I called them on XXXX ). 

I have attached proof of all the email and chat conversations with the XXXX and the buyer respectively, the call log history with Chase claims department and customer support. 

I performed all the steps to report these fraudulent transactions including a police report, contacting XXXX and chase bank in a time-sensitive manner. I still had to suffer the harm and I believe it could have been prevented or resolved. 

The following are the reasons I believe Chase bank should have done a better job in preventing or resolving the harm. 
1. Insufficient guidance- I was not guided sufficiently on next steps to deal with this fraud/scam. For an instance, I was asked to contact XXXX immediately after the incident while XXXX pay clearly suggested to contact Chase bank since the payment was initiated by XXXX feature in Chase mobile bank app. I was informed about the difference between fraud and scam on XX/XX/XXXX ( seven days later ) when I asked how it would change the way claim department would deal with it. The unnecessary delay of two weeks in applying XXXX XXXX and the consideration of fraud vs scam lead to a lack of recovery from the partner bank since it was too late ( as the money was withdrawn already from the account ) while the result could have been different had the chase bank approached the partner bank on the same day of the incident report. 
2. Misinformation- The denial letter indicated that the claim was denied as discussed while there was no discussion of why claim would be denied. 
3. False reassurance- I was reassured falsely that I will get the payment based on Fraud consideration instead of giving the clear direction of next steps. 

Please review my request and consider it for refund of the money I lost. 

Thank you.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
In adherence to the mandates delineated within the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I hereby submit this formal communication to revoke any and all authorizations, whether consciously or unwittingly conveyed, whether manifest in written or unwritten form, verbal or non-verbal. This consumer reporting agency " XXXX XXXX '' and " XXXX XXXX XXXX '' are reporting an account to the major consumer reporting agencies Equifax and XXXX credit report and other consumer reports that should not be reporting. This is a violation of " 15 U.S. Code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. '' I never received any written instructions nor gave any instruction to furnish this data. " 15 U.S. Code 1681a - Definitions ; rules of construction The term " consumer reporting agency '' means any person which, for monetary fees, dues, or on a cooperative nonprofit basis, regularly engages in whole or in part in the practice of assembling or evaluating consumer credit information or other information on consumers for the purpose of furnishing consumer reports to third parties, and which uses any means or facility of interstate commerce for the purpose of preparing or furnishing consumer reports.

The term " consumer '' means an individual.

The term " consumer report '' means any written, oral, or other communication of any information by a consumer reporting agency bearing on a consumer 's credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living. According to P.L 90-321 ( 82 Stat. 146 ) which states that " any agency can only get your report in response to a request by the head of a State or local child support enforcement agency ( or a State or local government official authorized by the head of such an agency ). '' They never received any request from such agency so this is also another violation. Also according to " 15 U.S. Code 1681c - Requirements relating to information contained in consumer reports Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information : Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. No adverse item besides the conviction of crimes should be on your report any item that is a derogatory mark is not allowed into consumer reports. '' Another violation from the consumer reporting agency " XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ''. Also another violation from this consumer reporting agency " XXXX XXXX XXXX '' is a violation of 12 CFR 1022.3 Definitions Identity theft means a fraud committed or attempted using the identifying information of another person without authority. They never received my authority to to furnish this information to Equifax or XXXX. 15 U.S. Code 1681e states '' Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681c of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681b of this title. '' Equifax and XXXX are not maintaining reasonable procedures. " According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act XXXX5 USC 1681 section 602 a states " There is a need to insure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumer 's right to privacy. '' Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX are consumer reporting agencies under 15 U.S. Code 1681a and I am the Consumer. I have the right to make sure my private information isn't shared which is backed by 15 USC 6801 which states '' It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers ' nonpublic personal information. '' Under this title they are financial institutions. Also 12 CFR 1016.7 states that " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. '' I am opting out of your reporting services.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Unable to get your credit report or credit score
Sub-issue: Problem getting your free annual credit report
Consumer complaint narrative:
After doing this I'm not able to get in. 
Experian Logo Membership ID # XXXX Sign In Decorative Image I'M NOT ABLE TO GET ANYONE REGARDLESS OF WHAT TIME OF DAY. 


Finish resetting your password We verified your info, but you still need to create a new password. Finish up in the next 30 minutes so you don't have to start over. 
Finish now Calling Experian Customer Care at XXXX Reaching a customer service representative when calling Experian for any kind of credit report question is a difficult process. I recently called Experian to speak with someone seeking advice for improving my credit score but was never connected to a live agent. Instead, the call was disconnected after repetitive recordings sending me to Experian 's website for assistance. 

Upon calling, the automated system directs you to enter your Social Security number for identity verification, followed by a second authentication using either your ZIP Code or street number. I was guided to enter all three numbers before the automated system asked my reason for calling. The recording directs you to say in a few words exactly what you need. 

Without any specific menu options, I said the words 'raise credit score, ' but the system misheard me and thought I wanted information about freezing my credit file. This led to a recording telling me I could freeze my credit file to prevent creditors from accessing my information and could unfreeze my account by visiting Experian 's website. After providing me with the web link, the call hung up with no options to return to the main menu. 

I called again, going through the same verification process with my personal information. This time, I said the words 'credit score, ' which led the automated system to ask if I'd like instructions over the phone to receive my credit report or to be directed to the website. Neither of these choices was what I wanted, so I attempted to reach an agent by saying 'customer service. ' The automated recording recognized my request but, rather than transfer me to a customer service rep, stated that I could choose from options including credit freeze, order a credit report or file a fraud claim. Again, I said the words 'customer service ' since I needed none of these options, but the recording only acknowledged my request by saying that more information was needed. 

At this point, I was on the phone for at least 10 minutes attempting to reach someone or access a better choice. I said the words 'main menu, ' which returned me to the same automated message asking if I'd like instructions over the phone for accessing my credit score information or via the website. A third attempt at saying 'customer service ' led to a new automated recording indicating that the system could only transfer callers to specialists in limited circumstances, but I could press 1 for self-service. Apparently, my call wasn't considered one of those 'limited circumstances ' that could be transferred. 

After pressing 1 led me nowhere but to the repetitive messages, I hung up the phone and visited the website as the automated system directed to find a long list of frequently asked questions. As I learned, it's a very trying process to speak with an Experian rep via phone, as their system seems set up for automated requests only.

Consumer complaint narrative: I, XXXX XXXX, am a federally protected consumer and I am filing this complaint against Equifax. Equifax is in direct violation in regards to the information that is being furnished on my consumer report. I would like to state that Equifax is in violation of 15 USC 1681b ( a ) ( 2 ), which clearly states that information furnished must be in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer. I, the consumer, never gave Equifax any written consent to report anything on my consumer report. NO CONSENT = IDENTITY THEFT. The following inquiries are being fraudulently furnished. I did not authorize, benefit from, nor consent to these inquiries and I demand they be removed from my consumer report immediately : XX/XX/2020, XX/XX/2020. If these inquiries are not removed, I will hold Equifax criminally liable for willful noncompliance and aggravated identity theft pursuant 15 USC 1681a ( q ) ( 3 ) since fraud is being committed using my identifying information. These negative items on my consumer report are preventing me from having a fair and equitable consumer report according to 15 USC 1681b. If Equifax can not provide to me a copy of when I sent a written permissible purpose to validate this inquiry, I demand for it to be deleted in 4 days. Enclosed is the FTC Identity Theft Report which states the above mentioned inquiries that are being fraudulently furnished along with a letter from XXXX XXXX XXXX stating they are unable to remove inquiry.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Problem with personal statement of dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
Based on

my records and knowledge: Circumstance: XX/XX/XXXX - I
submitted a re-investigation through the Major Credit Bureau, XXXX   COMENITYBANK/VICTORIA for the purposes of debt validation (to ensure accurate amount charged off, and to ensure that this is in fact my debt).

The high balance is showing: $XXXX & credit limit of: $XXXX

Issue: Considering the amount of time this debt has been on my report (over 6 years), I have no supporting documentation in my records to support the validity (proof) of the charged off amount of $XXXX And according to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, it's within my right as the consumer to "ask the collector to verify the debt."

Circumstance: Per XXXX   - Re-investigation Results: This item remained unchanged from our processing of your dispute in XX/XX/XXXX.

Issue: No clarification of documentation provided from the 3 major Credit Bureaus or Comenity Bank/Victoria.

Circumstance: As time went on, this item continued on my credit report. I submitted another re-investigation via XXXX in XX/XX/XXXX to attempt once again to verify that correct amount of this debt.

XX/XX/XXXX Results of Re-Investigation from XX/XX/XXXX: Read "This item was updated from our processing of your dispute in XX/XX/XXXX."

Issue: I checked what "update" came from the dispute, and as I reviewed the "Balance History" via my XXXX Credit Report, I noticed that in the month of "XX/XX/XXXX" it has an amount of $XXXX   noted as a payment, on this charged off amount. Based on my recollection, I have made no payment to Comenity Bank/Victoria during that month!

Please explain how this information is accurate? What type of "reporting" game are you playing?

On XX/XX/XXXX I called Comenity Bank/Victoria's on XXXX: I explained to "XXXX" that I wanted to resolve a charged-off account showing on my credit report.

"XXXX" was polite and helpful, and informed he would transfer me to the "Payment Solutions Center" I waited on hold, where 2 minutes later "XXXX" took my personal information and transferred me to another department where Mr. XXXX" took my call.

Issue: Here is where the main issue comes in. Mr. XXXX started again, retrieving personal information to verify MY identity" NOT the account. Mr. XXXX demeanor was short, rude abrasive and simply un-professional, when I asked him questions regarding the actual balance, interest and, simply the validity of the amount that is being reported!

I asked Mr. XXXX is there any way he could send me a copy of the charge-off account so I can verify the entire debt, and Mr. XXXX refused!! The conversation went into a verbal exchange between me and Mr. XXXX. Mr. XXXX   stated; you know this is your debt, as to bait me into compliance to pay a charged-off account that I called to resolve!

Simply put, if you are going to be in business for a company to negotiate with people and money, I would recommend you replace Mr. XXXX with someone who can actually achieve results, when consumers FINALLY call to settle matters that have to DEAL with THEIR MONEY! I DON'T CARE WHAT IS OWED OR HOW LONG IT HAS BEEN, A little more TACT on Mr. XXXX's part WOULD HAVE went A LONG WAY!

This charge off in the amount of $XXXX is scheduled to stay on my until "XX/XX/XXXX" as it appears to me Comenity/BANK is attempting to find little ways to "continue" this charge-off reporting on my credit much longer than 7 years!

To resolve this matter that is long overdue on my part! And in contrast, at this point would be of benefit to this LARGE BANK to resolve this matter in a professional/business manner to have one less "charged-off" account to deal with!

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
On Friday, XX/XX/XXXX at XXXXXXXX XXXX, I received an email from Relay Financial stating that " Your login credentials have been locked due to suspicious activity ''. I immediately emailed them asking to reinstate the account as I needed to submit some payments. 

I received a canned response on Monday, XX/XX/XXXX at XXXXXXXX XXXX asking a series of questions concluding the email with : " Our security system has temporarily locked your account due to an unfamiliar login being made. As soon we receive this information we can work on troubleshooting this issue. We apologize for any inconvenience this causes. ". 

I followed up indicating that while I appreciated their attempts to keep my account secure, I did not have time to help them troubleshoot their system and just needed my account unlocked. I offered to provide any supporting documentation required to verify my identity but I got the same canned response back. 

After several more emails going back and forth trying to get them to unlock my account, I requested instructions on how to close my account and transfer my balances to a different bank. I was told that in order to do so I had to login to my account online to initial a wire transfer. Following my reply pointing out that I was unable to login and that they were not willing to verify my identity to unlock the account, they sent me the same instructions to help them troubleshoot the issue. 

At this point, I decided to file a CFPB complaint as I was going in circles and not making any progress.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XX/XX/year> Equifax Information Services LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Request for Method of Validation and Account Verification In response to confirmation # XXXX Dear Equifax XXXX Department, I am writing regarding your recent response to my dispute of account listed on my credit report, in which you indicated that the account was verified as accurate. I have concerns about the completeness and accuracy of the information reported and request further clarification. The confirmation # XXXX is the investigation I'm responding to. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am entitled to receive a description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information, including the contact information of the party that provided the verification. Specifically, I am requesting : 1. The method of validation used to verify the disputed account ( s ).

2. The contact information for the creditor or furnisher, including their name, address, and phone number.

3. A detailed explanation of how the account ( s ) was verified for accuracy and completeness.

4. The date, time, and who exactly verified this account 5. A detailed explanation of how the account ( s ) were verified for accuracy and completeness, particularly regarding : -Balance amount -Past-due amount -Account status -Charge-off amount -Date of XXXX Delinquency -High Credit -Amount past due -Status -Date of last payment -Entire payment history The specific account ( s ) in question are as follows : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX # XXXX If the accounts can not be properly verified or XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX deleted from my credit report promptly, as required by the FCRA. 


Please provide the requested information within XXXX days of receipt of this letter. Failure to do so will result in further action on my part, which may include filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and other regulatory agencies. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 


Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX
