Consumer complaint narrative:
I want to put in this complaint in for the last time. We live in a country where its citizens are supposed to be innocent until proven guilty. That holds true everywhere except for credit. We are not told that something is being placed in our report. We are not given time to defend ourselves about the information. It is thrown on our report and then we have to spend our time trying to prove the information is not ours, or inaccurate, even if it ours it changes from agency to another. I have been A XXXX for 25 years. I have borrowed and paid back tens of millions of dollars. In this country, you are defined by a number. The problem with that is that you have three credit Bureau agencies who have no customer to satisfy. They continue to skirt their obligations of accuracy and their due diligence to make sure what they are reporting is in fact correct. I will prove this with the information that I'm about to give and upload to you. According to the according to the fair Credit Act, Over the past year, I have filed a dispute on a numerous error, and asked for documented verification of certain items. Only to be sent letters to say verified. I have sent on 4 different times to disputes with XXXX XXXX, XXXX, Experian with not much success. The success of my business depends on my ability to borrow, which has been devastated these past 5 years. I have XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and I can not even get a mortgage for me at XXXX XXXX XXXX. I recently filed a complaint through CFPB only to have the same thing happen. I am asking for the CFPB to look over my evidence. This time I am using the 3 reports against each other. You will see inconsistencies from agency to agency in the same report. You will see inconsistencies in their report. How is it that one agency is able to get information about when a last payment was made, but the other agency can't report it because they don't know it. Balances that are different from agency to agency. Dates that are inconsistent from agency to agency. Past due amounts that are inconsistent from agency to agency. When the last time there was a update reported inconsistent from agency to agency. And even agencies report that say something was paid on this date but then you look in their history graph and it shows something completely different. What's more amazing is that they've had five opportunities to get this information correct and as of XX/XX/2023, I pulled all three from the annual credit site. And found again numerous data that didn't match from one agency to the other. How do you know what is correct if one agency says your balance is this and another agency says it's this. Doesn't this prove that out of five times they're not doing their job, but my livelihood is tied to people who it appears has no desire or ability to get inf0rmation correct. So, I am coming to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to beg for protection. The Fair Credit Act also states that if there is an inkling of inaccurate information it must be removed. When you have these agencies reporting on the same company yet, the information is not consistent, then how do you know if any of it is true? I am begging for your help to look at what I'm sending. And force them to remove these items from my credit. So that might get my life back. Most of Americans don't have the ability to sue them directly. That's why we need you. To be our hammer and hold them accountable. Five times this past year, they had claimed verified. But as you will see they're still inconsistent information so somebody's lying. The problem is we don't know which one therefore it needs to be removed permanently. I would appreciate your help in this matter. I am uploading a list of the items and their inconsistency from one agency to the other. I am also uploading stats and articles pertaining to the agencies inability to house accurate information. Also letters that I have sent. I have broken down for each one and written out exactly the inconsistencies which you could see for yourself in these reports. These agencies have violated my rights as a citizen of the United States. I am asking you to force them to remove these items and remove them permanently. See the links to get credit report below. 
Thank you sincerely XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXExperian.XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Experian XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have spent long periods working overseas and my credit file is essentially empty. There is nothing negative in my credit file. Now that I have returned to the US I went to a bank to open an account, a credit card, and to inquire about a mortgage. When the bank accessed my TransUnion credit report, another person 's name and addresses came up. That person 's name is XXXX XXXX, of XXXX, Michigan. I have never used that name and have never been to XXXX Michigan. 

There is also credit information in the report that does not belong to me. I 'm assuming that just XXXX loan was mis-entered so that my ssn became associated with this other person 's name and address. So although the credit information is not negative, it has taken my identity and made it impossible to proceed in establishing and using credit. 

When I opened a retirement account through my new employer, security questions such as " With which of these addresses have you been associated '' were matched to addresses in towns where I have never lived. I moved on to other questions that actually pertained to me, but there were more questions that were relevant to this other individual than there were that were relevant to me. 

I reported this to TransUnion XXXX, once on the XXXX of XXXX, and once around the middle of the month. To my knowledge they have taken no steps to resolve this matter. My entire life is on hold until they resolve this matter. 

Given the enormous responsibility of credit reporting agencies, such as TransUnion, I expect communication and proactivity when they are presented with such a claim. If they can not quickly resolve mistakes of their making, they should not be allowed to play such an important role in the lives of consumers. Resolving this quickly is the most important item on my " master '' to-do list, and I ask for your help. Thank you, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Bank of America froze my loan. They, the home equity line of credit division, told me that my house had lost equity. Therefor they had to freeze my loan. I got comps showing that my house had increased in equity. Then they said that my credit report was not good. I got copies. They admitted to me and to XXXX, loan officer at Bank of America, XXXX XXXX, California, that my credit was good. And it is. Then I received a notice saying that I had material changes in my financial circumstances and they would have to freeze the loan. This, freezing my loan, took place in XXXX, XXXX and has continued since. 
I asked to see a signed copy of my contract. They do not have one. They have stalled on this now for nine months. I had insurance should I not be able to pay my loan. They said I had cancelled it. I asked for a signed copy of such a cancellation. They do n't have one of course. 
They have also claimed that they had to freeze my loan because of liens. Those liens were on my home since XXXX, well before I established the line of credit. 
I have continued making payments, have asked for proof. Every conversation I have with them tells me that they intend to take my house and they will listen to nothing. Here 's the thing : The comps say that my house is valued at {$230.00}, I currently owe only {$22000.00}. My realtor, as I have my house up for sale, represents bank of America with foreclosures in my area. She claims she has seen B of A do this same scam with others. 
So ... I had arranged to leave the last {$3000.00} untouched and use for payments. The bank has put unnatural pressure on me by freezing my loan. 
So what happened next.? First they charge me late fees when there are n't any. ( I have made sure XXXX XXXX B of A monitors all my payments now. ) They have raised the amount of pay back to XXXX rather than XXXX or 31 days three months in a row. XXXX has practically yelled at them over the phone telling them they ca n't do that. XXXX XXXX used to work in B o A loan department. ) An employee in the department confided to me that they should n't be doing this to me. Her name is XXXX. XXXX I had a recording. XXXX, XXXX of B o A XXXX XXXX fought for me. Just retired. He thought what they were doing was ridiculous. 
Next I get a letter from B of A saying that my loan expires on XXXX, XXXX and I will either have to pay back loan in full or I will be paying much larger payments per month. This last loan began in XXXX. And already I have to pay it back in large sums. 

My issues are XXXX those listed at the bottom of this page : Making payments, signing agreement, problems when you are unable to pay..

Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently, I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate. 

Under 15 U.S Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report. It shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

15 U.S. Code 1691i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information as appropriate, based on the results of the investigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

I tried to explain to representative that I had already went through the dispute process multiple times and that this issue was still not corrected she did not seem to care nor understand and instead offered to initiate a dispute

Im submitting a complaint to you today to inform you I was the victim of identity theft. Here is the list of accounts/items which do not belong to me or were opened without my permission. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Balance : {$0.00}, XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX Date Opened XX/XX/XXXX Balance {$0.00}, XXXX XXXX XXXX Date XX/XX/XXXX Balance {$0.00}, XXXX OF XXXX XXXX Opened Date XX/XX/XXXX Balance {$4600.00}, XXXX XXXX Opened Date XX/XX/XXXX Balance {$3300.00}, XXXX XXXX  XXXX Opened Date XX/XX/XXXX Balance : {$13000.00}, and ( Original Creditor : ) XXXX Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Balance : {$140.00}. 

According to FCRA Section 605B ( a ) the CREDIT REPORTING AGENCIES shall block any information in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identity theft, not later than 4 business days after the date of receipt.

Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative: Citi Financial credit card company is refusing to credit my account for payments made for the month of XXXX. I submitted XXXX payment on XXXX XXXX, XXXX. I always call to verify payments went through. When I called, they said it did n't go through, they said I " had never used that account before. '' They would not tell me what account they were talking about or verify what account number they were using. I used an account I have used for years, which has more than adequate money to cover the payment. I resubmitted the payment, by phone, to the customer service representative on XXXX XXXX, XXXX. When I called on XXXX XXXX, XXXX, to verify they had made the payment, again it was not credited. I submitted the XXXX payment again, even though they still would not verify they had transcribed the account number correctly. On XXXX XXXX, when I called again to verify, it was still not credited. I submitted another XXXX  payment. You see, this is a XXXX interest account which will start charging interest if a payment is made late. Again, Citi refused to tell me the account number they were using or if they had miss written the number. Finally, I transferred entire balance to a different card and attempted to close Citi. They keep adding fees & will not close it. I never received a bill, either.
